Key Match Events: Giancarlo Stanton hit a go-ahead homer in the eighth inning.
Stanton finished with three hits, drove in two runs and stole a base for the first time in four years.
Luke Weaver earned the save and capped 4 1/3 scoreless innings by the New York bullpen.
The Yankees drew nine walks, giving them 22 for the series.
The Royals' Bobby Witt Jr. got his first hit of the series.
Miscellaneous Highlights: It was the first playoff game at Kauffman Stadium in 3,268 days, since the Royals beat the Mets in Game 2 of the 2015 World Series.
Eric Hosmer, the first baseman on the Royals' 2015 World Series team, delivered the first pitch for a crowd that included Chiefs quarterback Patrick Mahomes.
